column4: if i got a .zip file in my email how do i get it in the terminal as a wget?
if i got a .zip file in my email how do i get it in the terminal as a wget?
if i got a .zip file in my email how do i get it in the terminal and do a wget?
if i got a .zip file in my email how do i get it in the terminal and do a wget?
good question!
sarcasm?
No.  It's just a hard question
oh ok, ill make it easier.
I think you have to use a mail program.  You could use a CLI one if that's the issue
CLI?
command line  (not graphical)
i dont know what that is.
The GUI is stuff you click on.  The terminal is CLI
Why do you need to wget things from an email??
thats the only way i know how to get files. I just wanted to get a .zip file from my email so i can extract it in terminal.
How do you view your emails normally?
wget is used to download things from the web, email is not web
i just open my email. So i downloaded the .zip file so how could i get it in terminal?
cd into the folder you downloaded it into
yea but i need to get it in to a shell.
Read up on how to use the terminal and the answer will be very clear
